top_10_papers.title: Technical Report: Performance Comparison of Service Mesh Frameworks: the MTLS Test Case
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Evaluates how mTLS implementation affects performance across major service mesh platforms (Istio, Istio Ambient, Linkerd, Cilium) in Kubernetes environments. Key findings show significant performance differences stem from architectural choices between sidecar and sidecarless approaches.
top_10_papers.relevance_notes: Directly addresses mTLS performance in service-to-service authentication, critical for agent-to-agent communications in production environments.
key_findings: Significant performance differences between sidecar and sidecarless architectures
mTLS overhead varies substantially across service mesh implementations
Latency and resource consumption metrics for production deployments

top_10_papers.title: DID Link: Authentication in TLS with Decentralized Identifiers and Verifiable Credentials
top_10_papers.conference: 21st Annual International Conference on Privacy, Security, and Trust (PST2024)
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Proposes innovative authentication mechanism for TLS 1.3 utilizing decentralized identifiers anchored to distributed ledgers instead of traditional CAs. Enables entities to authenticate with self-issued X.509 certificates while supporting verifiable credentials.
top_10_papers.relevance_notes: Addresses certificate management and authentication in TLS without traditional PKI, relevant for distributed agent systems requiring dynamic certificate issuance.
key_findings: Comparable handshake performance when cached
Speed advantages over alternative decentralized protocols
Eliminates dependency on traditional certificate authorities

top_10_papers.title: An Efficient TLS 1.3 Handshake Protocol with VC Certificate Type
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Presents advancement in TLS handshake design incorporating Verifiable Credentials while maintaining RFC-8446 compliance and TLS 1.3 security features. Uses standard TLS 1.3 messages with minimal OpenSSL modifications.
top_10_papers.relevance_notes: Directly relevant to TLS 1.3 authentication improvements, applicable to agent-to-agent mutual authentication with modern credential types.
key_findings: Performance comparable to traditional PKI/X.509 solutions
Minimal modifications to OpenSSL required
Potential applications for decentralized identity in IoT

top_10_papers.title: Hybrid Online Certificate Status Protocol with Certificate Revocation List for Smart Grid Public Key Infrastructure
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Proposes hybrid approach combining OCSP with Certificate Revocation Lists to distribute query workloads more effectively. Aims to improve system robustness and efficiency for infrastructure handling tens of thousands of meters.
top_10_papers.relevance_notes: Directly addresses real-time certificate revocation performance, combining OCSP and CRL for scalable revocation checking - critical for topic requirements.
key_findings: Hybrid OCSP-CRL approach decreases query resource demands
Increased efficiency demonstrated through simulations
Scalable to tens of thousands of devices

top_10_papers.title: Adaptive Optimization of TLS Overhead for Wireless Communication in Critical Infrastructure
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Proposes dynamically configuring TLS to adapt algorithms, parameters, and settings to best meet currently occurring resource and security constraints in wireless communication scenarios.
top_10_papers.relevance_notes: Addresses TLS performance optimization for resource-constrained environments, relevant for agent systems with varying network conditions.
key_findings: Dynamic TLS configuration adapts to resource constraints
Optimizes resource utilization while strengthening security
Applicable to critical infrastructure wireless networks

top_10_papers.title: Current Affairs: A Security Measurement Study of CCS EV Charging Deployments
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: First comprehensive security evaluation of publicly deployed CCS DC charging stations across 4 European countries, analyzing 325 chargers from 26 manufacturers. Only 12% implement TLS security, with significant PKI flaws identified.
top_10_papers.relevance_notes: Real-world measurement study of TLS and certificate revocation (OCSP, CRL) deployment in critical infrastructure, highlighting practical challenges.
key_findings: Only 12% of chargers implement TLS security
OCSP and CRL mechanisms examined in production deployments
Significant flaws in PKI implementation identified

top_10_papers.title: Decentralized Credential Status Management: A Paradigm Shift in Digital Trust
top_10_papers.conference: BRAINS 2024 (6th Conference on Blockchain Research & Applications)
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Examines transition from centralized to decentralized certificate status management. Blockchain technologies enhance security and trust distribution but face computational bottlenecks.
top_10_papers.relevance_notes: Addresses decentralized approaches to certificate status checking, relevant for distributed agent systems without central authority.
key_findings: Blockchain enhances security and trust distribution
Computational bottlenecks identified in parallel computation
Framework proposed to address decentralization limitations

top_10_papers.title: CRSet: Private Non-Interactive Verifiable Credential Revocation
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Addresses privacy gaps in credential revocation systems. Current solutions like Bitstring Status List can expose issuer activity metrics. CRSet leverages Ethereum blob transactions for secure data publishing with local revocation checks.
top_10_papers.relevance_notes: Novel approach to privacy-preserving certificate revocation, highly relevant for agent systems requiring non-interactive revocation checking.
key_findings: Non-interactive revocation mechanism preserving privacy
One Ethereum blob fits revocation data for ~170k VCs
Trades space efficiency for enhanced privacy characteristics

top_10_papers.title: EDHOC is a New Security Handshake Standard: An Overview of Security Analysis
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Summarizes standardized EDHOC protocol, reviews formal security analyses, and identifies potential directions for future investigation.
top_10_papers.relevance_notes: EDHOC is lightweight alternative to TLS handshake for constrained environments, relevant for IoT agent authentication scenarios.
key_findings: Comprehensive security analysis of EDHOC standard
Formal verification of handshake protocol
Alternative to TLS for constrained devices

top_10_papers.title: Quantum-Safe integration of TLS in SDN networks
top_10_papers.abstract_summary: Addresses quantum computing vulnerability of current PKI. Proposes hybridizing classical, quantum, and post-quantum cryptographic approaches within TLS for SDN. Features QKD key extraction, rekeying, crypto-agility, and backward compatibility.
top_10_papers.relevance_notes: Forward-looking approach to TLS security with post-quantum cryptography, important for long-term agent authentication security.
key_findings: Hybrid classical-quantum-post-quantum TLS implementation
QKD integration with TLS in production infrastructure
Crypto-agility with backward compatibility
